metadata.title: CVE-2023-44487 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
The HTTP/2 protocol allows a denial of service (server resourceconsumption) because request cancellation can reset many streams quickly,as exploited in the wild in August through October 2023.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-44487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.13+esm3
vim-haproxy - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.13+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libnghttp2-14 - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1+esm2
nghttp2 - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1+esm2
nghttp2-client - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1+esm2
nghttp2-proxy - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1+esm2
nghttp2-server - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: haproxy package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu0.13+esm3').
tomcat9 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
tomcat8 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
trafficserver package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
h2o package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
nghttp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.30.0-1ubuntu1+esm2').
nodejs package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
